text: “And when another forty years had passed, Angel of the LordThere is no definite article with “angel”. Comparing Exodus 3:2 and 4 it is clear that “the Angel of the Lord” was Jehovah Himself, presumably the Son. Perhaps 2% of the Greek manuscripts, of objectively inferior quality, omit ‘of the Lord’ (as in NIV, NASB, LB, TEV, etc.). appeared to him in the wilderness of Mount Sinai,Moses was in Midian, so the real Mount Sinai is in Midian, which is part of Arabia, not the peninsula between the ‘rabbit ears’ of the Red Sea. For a discussion of this, please see the Appendix: “Where is Mt. Sinai?” in a flame of fire in a bush.
